text.p: McDonnell Douglas Corp said Friday it has secured the sale and options for sale of 14 advanced versions of its MD Explorer helicopter.
The MD Explorer helicopter sells for about $3.5 million each valuing the total sale at about $49 million.

Two of the new helicopters will go to Tomen Corp, which will resell them to an undisclosed buyer. A third will go to Luxembourg Air Rescue in an air-medical configuration. The remaining 11 aircraft will go to an undisclosed customer in Puerto Rico. Three of these are firm sales and the remainder are options.

The advanced MD Explorer, a performance-enhanced version of the MD Explorer introduced in 1995, is a twin-turbine, eight-place aircraft in use in utility, executive transport, electronic news gathering and air medical service in Europe, South America, the United States and the Far East.
The new helicopter is expected to receive Federal Aviation Administration certification in late summer, with first deliveries following soon after.
